sen.j: 人間国宝（にんげんこくほう）は、日本の文化財保護法に基づき同国の文部科学大臣が指定した重要無形文化財の保持者として各個認定された人物を指す通称である。
sen.e: Living National Treasure is the common name of individual authorized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology based on the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in Japan.

Living National Treasure is a Japanese popular term for individuals certified as Preservers of Important Intangible Cultural Properties by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology based on the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Living National Treasure is a Japanese popular term for individuals certified as Preservers of Important Intangible Cultural Properties by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology based on the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 文化財保護法には「人間国宝」という文言はないが、重要無形文化財保持者を指して人間国宝と呼ぶ通称が広く用いられている。
sen.e: There was no wording "Living National Treasure" in the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term "Living National Treasure" is not formally recognized by the law, but is an informal term used as a reference to cultural properties designated as the National Treasures of Japan.
sen.cmt: the original wikipedia article has these two sentences written as one, so I moved the sentence from the lower cell and made changes in red to the Japanese to match the article
sen.e: The term "Living National Treasure" is not formally recognized by the law, but is an informal term used as a reference to cultural properties designated as the National Treasures of Japan.

sen.j: 人間国宝は、重要無形文化財保持者として各個認定された人物を指す通称である。
sen.e: Living National Treasure is the common name of individual authorized as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
Living National Treasure is a term for those designated as holders of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Living National Treasure is a term for those designated as holders of Important Intangible Cultural Property.

sen.j: 日本の文化財保護法において、無形文化財とは、演劇、音楽、工芸技術その他の無形の文化的所産で我が国にとつて歴史上又は芸術上価値の高いものをいう（同法第2条第1項第2号）。
sen.e: In the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in Japan, Intangible Cultural Property means intangible cultural products such as play, music, industrial art and those historically or artistically valuable for Japan (second paragraph of Article 2 of the said law).

Under the Law for Protection of Cultural Properties, intangible cultural properties are defined as dramatic, musical, artistic and other intangible cultural artifacts deemed as historically or artistically valuable to Japanese history (Article 2, Section 1, Part 2).
sen.cmt: Fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Under the Law for Protection of Cultural Properties, intangible cultural properties are defined as dramatic, musical, artistic and other intangible cultural artifacts deemed as historically or artistically valuable to Japanese history (Article 2, Section 1, Part 2).

sen.j: 無形文化財のなかでも特に重要なものを、文部科学大臣は重要無形文化財に指定する（同法第71条第1項）（この点については重要無形文化財の項を参照）。
sen.e: Especially important cultural properties of those intangible cultural properties are designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology designates (first paragraph of Article 71 of the said law) (for this matter, see Section of Important Intangible Cultural Property).

Intangible cultural properties of special importance are designated as "Important Intangible Cultural Properties" by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology (Article 71, Section 1) (For further information, see the section on Important Intangible Cultural Property).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Intangible cultural properties of special importance are designated as "Important Intangible Cultural Properties" by the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology (Article 71, Section 1) (For further information, see the section on Important Intangible Cultural Property).

sen.j: すなわち、無形文化財とは芸能、工芸技術等の無形の「わざ」そのものを指す。
sen.e: That is, intangible cultural property means intangible 'art' itself such as, play, industrial art.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In other words, intangible cultural property refers to certain "art," such as arts and crafts or performing arts.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In other words, intangible cultural property refers to certain 'art,' such as arts and crafts or performing arts.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: その「わざ」はこれを高度に体得している個人または団体が体現する。
sen.e: This 'art' is embodied by an individual or group who is the master of the art.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Individuals or groups who have attained a high level of mastery in certain skills can be certified by the Japanese government as the preservers of their art and they receive support to ensure their continuation.
sen.cmt: Turned these two sentences into one and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Individuals or groups have attained a high level of mastery in certain skills.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて2文に分けました。

sen.j: そして、日本国政府はこの「わざ」を体現する個人または団体を重要無形文化財の保持者または保持団体に認定し、その継承の支援と保護を行っている。
sen.e: Then, Japanese government authorizes an individual or group who embodies the 'art' as a holder or holder's group of important cultural property, and gives support to and protects the succession.
Then, Japanese government authorizes an individual or group who embodies the 'art' as a holder or holder's group of important cultural property, and gives support to and protects the succession.
Individuals or groups who have attained mastery in certain skills can be certified by the Japanese government as the preservers of their art and they receive support to ensure their continuation.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて2文に分けました。

sen.j: 重要無形文化財の保持者または保持団体の認定の方式には、「各個認定」「総合認定」「保持団体認定」の3種がある。
sen.e: There are three ways of authorizations for a holder or holder's group of important intangible cultural property: 'Individual authorization'; 'general authorization'; 'holder's group authorization.'

There are three types of certifications for individuals or groups who hold important intangible cultural property: "Individual Certification," "General Certification," and "Preservation Group Certification."
sen.cmt: authorization→certification; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: There are three types of certifications for individuals or groups who hold important intangible cultural property: 'Individual Certification,' 'General Certification,' and 'Preservation Group Certification.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 各個認定は保持者個人の認定、総合認定は集団を構成する保持者の認定、保持団体認定は保持団体の認定である。
sen.e: Individual authorization is for the authorization of individual holder, general authorization is for the authorization of holders which makes up a group, and holder's group authorization is for the authorization of holder's group.
Individual Certification is given to individual holders, General Certification is given to holders as an organized group, and Preservation Group Certification is given to the holders of a group.
Individual Certification is given to individual holders, General Certification is given to holders as an organized group, and Preservation Group Certification is given to the holders of a group.

sen.j: このうち「人間国宝」と呼ばれるのは、一般的には、個人が認定される各個認定の場合のみである。
sen.e: Of this, generally, those called 'Living National Treasure' are limited to individual authorization.
Within the three types of certification, those referred to as "Living National Treasure" is generally limited to those holding Individual Certification.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Within the three types of certification, those referred to as 'Living National Treasure' is generally limited to those holding Individual Certification.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 総合認定における団体の構成員、及び保持団体認定における当該団体およびその構成員については、人間国宝とは呼ばないのが一般的である。
sen.e: Generally, neither the members of group in general authorization nor the group or members of the group in holder's group authorization are called 'Living National Treasure.'
Those who are given General Certification or Preservation Group Certification are generally not referred to as a "Living National Treasure."
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Those who are given General Certification or Preservation Group Certification are generally not referred to as a Living National Treasure.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 演劇、音楽などの芸能の分野では「各個認定」と「人間国宝芸能分野における「総合認定」」が行われ、工芸技術の分野では「各個認定」と「人間国宝工芸技術分野における「保持団体認定」」が行われる。
sen.e: In public entertainment field such as play, music, 'individual authorization' and 'general authorization' in 'Living National Treasure - public entertainment field' take place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Individual Certification" and "General Certification" prevails within the fields of performing arts, such as plays and music, while "Individual Authorization" and "Preservation Group Certification"mainly occurs in the field of technical arts.
sen.cmt: The Japanese written is not the same as written in the original wikipedia article (the additional content is also missing the second 「」), so I changed it to red and left it out of the translation; this sentence and the sentence written in the cell below are also written as one sentence in the article, so I translated them as they are
sen.e: Individual Certification' and 'General Certification' prevails within the fields of performing arts, such as plays and music, while 'Individual Certification' and 'Preservation Group Certification' mainly occurs in the field of technical arts.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え前出の用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 各個認定
sen.e: Individual authorization
Individual Certification
Individual Certification

sen.j: 「重要無形文化財に指定される芸能を高度に体現できる者」または「工芸技術を高度に体得している者」が認定される。
sen.e: One who can embody public entertainment designated as Important Intangible Cultural Property at a high level' or 'one who is a master of industrial art' is authorized.

Certification is given to "individuals who are able to embody a performing art designated as an Important Intangible Cultural Property at the highest level," or "individuals who are a master of a technical art."

Certification is given to 'individuals who are able to embody a performing art designated as an Important Intangible Cultural Property at the highest level,' or 'individuals who are a master of a technical art.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 総合認定
sen.e: General authorization
General Certification
General Certification

sen.j: 「2人以上の者が一体となって芸能を高度に体現している場合」や「2人以上の者が共通の特色を有する工芸技術を高度に体得している場合」において、「これらの者が構成している団体の構成員」が認定される。
sen.e: When two or more persons are working together to embody public entertainment at a high level" or "when two or more persons are a master of industrial art sharing a certain characteristics', the members of a group including these people is authorized.

Certification is given to "two or more persons who are working together to embody a performing art at the highest level" or "two or more persons who are a master of a technical art that shares certain characteristics."

Certification is given to 'two or more persons who are working together to embody a performing art at the highest level' or 'two or more persons who are a master of a technical art that shares certain characteristics.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 保持団体認定
sen.e: Holder's group authorization
Preservation Group Certification
Preservation Group Certification

sen.j: 「芸能または工芸技術の性格上個人的特色が薄く」かつ「当該芸能または工芸技術を保持する者が多数いる場合」において、「これらの者が主たる構成員となっている団体」が認定される。
sen.e: When the public entertainment or industrial art is hardly individualistic' and 'when there are many holders of the relevant public entertainment or the industrial art', a group including these people as key members is authorized.

Certification is given to a group of key members within all of the holders when "the performing or technical art is not at all individualistic" and when "there are many holders of the relevant performing or technical art."
sen.cmt: changed sentence structure to flow more naturally
sen.e: Certification is given to a group of key members within all of the holders when 'the performing or technical art is not at all individualistic' and when 'there are many holders of the relevant performing or technical art.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 日本国政府は、重要無形文化財の保護を目的として、人間国宝（各個認定者）に対して年額200万円の特別助成金を交付している。
sen.e: Japanese government offers a special subsidy of 2 million YEN by the year to Living National Treasure (one authorized as Individual authorization) in order to protect Important Intangible Cultural Property.

In order to preserve important intangible cultural assets, the Japanese government provides a special annual subsidy of 2 million yen to Living National Treasures (those with Individual Certification).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In order to preserve important intangible cultural assets, the Japanese government provides a special annual subsidy of 2 million yen to Living National Treasures (those with Individual Certification).

sen.j: 保持団体に対しては伝承者養成事業や文化財公開事業に対してその経費の一部を助成している。
sen.e: For holder group, the government pays part of the costs for the successor training projects and cultural property publication projects.
In the case of groups, the government pays the costs of public exhibitions and successor training projects.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In the case of groups, the government pays the costs of public exhibitions and successor training projects.

sen.j: 国立劇場では能楽、文楽、歌舞伎などの後継者養成のための研修事業が行われている。
sen.e: National Theater has training projects in order to foster the successor of nogaku (the art of Noh), bunraku (Japanese puppet theater), Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).

The National Theater conducts training projects in order to foster successors to such arts as Nogaku (the art of Noh), Bunraku (Japanese puppet theater) and Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The National Theater conducts training projects in order to foster successors to such arts as Nogaku (the art of Noh), Bunraku (Japanese puppet theater) and Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).

tit.e: List of Living National Treasure (public entertainment)
List of Living National Treasures (performing arts)
List of Living National Treasures (performing arts)

sen.j: 芸能分野は、雅楽、能、文楽、歌舞伎、組踊、音楽、日本舞踊、演芸の8つの種別に分かれている。
sen.e: Public entertainment field consists of eight classes: Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), Noh (traditional masked dance-drama), bunraku (Japanese puppet theater), kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), kumiodori (combination dance), music, classical Japanese dance, and entertainment.

The performing arts field consists of eight classes: Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), Noh (traditional masked dance and drama), Bunraku (Japanese puppet theater), Kabuki (traditional drama peformed by male actors), Kumi Odori (combination dance), music, classical Japanese dance and entertainment.
sen.cmt: capitalized all names and changed "Public entertainment" to "performing arts"
sen.e: The performing arts field consists of eight classes: Gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music), Noh (traditional masked dance and drama), Bunraku, Kabuki, Kumi Odori (combination dance), music, classical Japanese dance and entertainment.
sen.cmt: 前出補足をのぞきました。

sen.j: 芸能分野における「総合認定」
sen.e: General authorization' in public entertainment field
General Certification in the field of performing arts
General Certification in the field of performing arts

sen.j: 各個認定はいわゆる「人間国宝」、つまりその分野について高度な技術を持つ「名人」に対して行われる。
sen.e: Individual authorization is intended for so-called 'Living National Treasure,' that is, highly skilled 'master' in relevant field.
Individual Certification is intended for the what they refer to as "Living National Treasure," or in other words, highly skilled "masters" in their field.
Individual Certification is intended for the what they refer to as 'Living National Treasure,' or in other words, highly skilled 'masters' in their field.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 一方で総合認定は、個人的な技術の高さではなく、ある芸能を保持し、後世に伝えてゆくために最低限必要な技量を持った人々に対して行われるものである。
sen.e: However, general authorization is intended for people who has the minimum level of skills needed to maintain and pass down a certain entertainment not high individual skills.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, General Certification is intended for people who have the minimum level of skills required to maintain and pass down the entertainment rather than having high individual skills.
On the other hand, General Certification is intended for people who have the minimum level of skills required to maintain and pass down the entertainment rather than having high individual skills.

sen.j: そして、その価値は実質上まったく異なる。
sen.e: Virtually, they have completely different values.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For all practical purposes, the value of the two certifcations are completely different.
For all practical purposes, the value of the two certifications are completely different.

sen.j: 総合認定が行われる分野は、一部の名人だけではなくその芸能自体が文化財保護の対象として考えられているものであるといえるだろう。
sen.e: For the field to which general authorization applies, not just a certain masters but whole entertainment are considered to be authorized.
In General Certification, rather than being applied to only a few masters of an art, the form of entertainment or craft as a whole is considered to be certified.
In General Certification, rather than being applied to only a few masters of an art, the form of entertainment or craft as a whole is considered to be certified.

sen.j: 現在、重要無形文化財の総合認定には、以下の11団体が認定されている。
sen.e: For the general authorization of Important Intangible Cultural Property, the following 11 groups are currently authorized.
For general certification of Important Intangible Cultural Property, the following 11 groups are currently certified.
For general certification of Important Intangible Cultural Property, the following 11 groups are currently certified.

sen.j: 総合認定の場合、「保持者」は、その団体の部員、会員、座員などである。
sen.e: In the general authorization, 'holder' includes staff members, trouper, club member of the group.
In the case of general certification, the 'holder' includes staff members, the troupe and club members of the group.
In the case of general certification, the 'holder' includes staff members, the troupe and club members of the group.

sen.j: 人数は延べ人数（過去に会員となった者の総数。故人を含む）で、平成12年度の数。
sen.e: Total number of people (accumulated number of members).
Total number of people (accumulated number of members in the past, including the deceased) in 2000.
sen.cmt: Moved the content in the cell underneath this one since it was dividing up information inside parenthesis; fixed grammar for clarity
sen.e: Total number of people (accumulated number of members in the past, including the deceased) in 2000.

sen.j: これらの団体には、多くの場合その母体となる全演奏家協会がある。
sen.e: These groups has a parent organization called All Nippon Players Association.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In many cases, these groups of have a parent organization called All Nippon Players Association.
sen.cmt: added "In many cases" to coincide with "多くの場合"; fixed grammar
sen.e: In many cases, these groups of have a parent organization called All Nippon Players Association.

sen.j: その中で技量の熟達が認められた者について、上記の各団体への加入が認められる （通常は会員の推挙または互選）。
sen.e: A player who is recognized for high degree of skill can join the above mentioned groups (generally, chosen or recommended by members).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Individuals recognized by their high degree of skill are able to join the above mentioned groups (generally they are chosen or recommended by current members).
Individuals recognized by their high degree of skill are able to join the above mentioned groups (generally they are chosen or recommended by current members).

sen.j: そして、各団体へ正式加入と同時に「重要無形文化財総合保持者」に認定される。
sen.e: When the player officially join the group, he or she is authorized as 'the general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One is certified with being a "General Holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property" upon officially joining one of these groups.
sen.cmt: authorized→certified; fixed sentence structure to read more smoothly
sen.e: One is certified with being a 'General Holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property' upon officially joining one of these groups.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 各団体ごとに選出母体となる団体があり、数年に一回程度追加認定（実質上の人数追加）がある。
sen.e: Each group has a parent organization which is responsible for selection, and additional authorization takes place once in many years (virtually, increase the number of members.)
Each group has a parent organization that is responsible for the selection of candidates and additional certification occurs once every few years (in essence to increase the number of members).
sen.cmt: authorizeation→certification; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Each group has a parent organization that is responsible for the selection of candidates and additional certification occurs once every few years (in essence to increase the number of members).

tit.j: 人間国宝の一覧（工芸技術）
tit.e: List of Living National Treasure (industrial art)
List of Living National Treasures (technical arts)
List of Living National Treasures (technical arts)

sen.j: 2008年までに認定された工芸技術部門の重要無形文化財保持者（各個認定）は以下の160名である（2008年（平成20年）9月11日付け認定分までを含む。）
sen.e: The following 160 people were authorized by 2008 (including those authorized by September 11, 2008) as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (individual authorization) in industrial art field.

The following 160 people were authorized by 2008 (including those authorized by September 11, 2008) as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (individual certification) in a technical art field.

The following 160 people were authorized by 2008 (including those authorized by September 11, 2008) as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (individual certification) in a technical art field.

tit.j: 工芸技術分野における「保持団体認定」
tit.e: Holder's group authorization' in industrial art field
Holders of group certification in the field of arts and crafts.
Preservation Group Certification' in the field of arts and crafts
tit.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 工芸技術分野において、工芸技術の性格上個人的特色が薄く、かつ、当該工芸技術を保持する者が多数いる場合において、これらの者が主たる構成員となっている団体としてとして認定されているもの、すなわち、保持団体認定は、以下の14件・14団体である。
sen.e: When industrial art is hardly individualistic in industrial art field and when there are many holders of the relevant industrial art, the following 14 subjects or 14 groups are authorized as groups including these people as key members, that is Holder's group authorization.

When technical arts are not individualistic within their field, and there are many holders of the art, the following 14 subjects or 14 groups are certified as the groups as key members, meaning they hold the Preservation Group Certification.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally; added "Preservation Group Certification" in place of "Holder's group authorization" for consistency
sen.e: When technical arts are not individualistic within their field, and there are many holders of the art, the following 14 subjects or 14 groups are certified as the groups as key members, meaning they hold the Preservation Group Certification.
